facts: First discovered in 1889 by Othniel Charles Marsh.
It is one of the most recognizable of all dinosaurs and the most well-known ceratopsid.
It shared the landscape with and was most likely preyed upon by Tyrannosaurus.
The largest known skull measures in at 5 feet long.
It had massive skull balanced by a long, heavy tail.
It is among the largest known land predators and is estimated to have exerted the strongest bite force among all terrestrial animals.
Anklyosaurus survived for approximately 135 million years.
It was one of the last of the non-avian dinosaurs.
It was quadrupedal, with a broad, robust body.
An asteroid was named 9954 Brachiosaurus in 1991.
It is regarded as a high browser, possibly cropping or nipping vegetation as high as 9 meters (30 ft) off the ground.

It has been used as an example of a dinosaur that was most likely ectothermic because of its large size and the corresponding need for sufficient forage, but more recent research suggests it was warm-blooded.
The Stegosaurus had between 17 and 22 seperate places and flat spines.
They were large, heavily built, herbivorous quadrupeds with rounded backs, short fore limbs, long hind limbs, and tails held high in the air.

It is generally agreed that their spiked tails were most likely used for defense against predators, while their plates may have been used primarily for display, and secondarily for thermoregulatory functions.
Elasmosaurus was a marine reptile first discovered in Kansas.
It was one of the longest-necked animals to have lived
The skull would have been slender and triangular, with large, fang-like teeth at the front, and smaller teeth towards the back.
Actually a flying reptile, the Pteranodon is not a dinosaur.
Pteranodon had toothless beaks, similar to those of birds.
The most distinctive characteristic of Pteranodon is its cranial crest.
